text:
e="preserve">Chet "JR" White (1979/1980 – October 18, 2020) was an American record producer, rock musician and mix engineer. He was a member of the indie rock band Girls until their disbandment in 2012. He produced the album "Goon" by Tobias Jesso Jr. and "Sob Story" by the Spectrals. White was born in Santa Cruz, California.
White died of a heart attack on October 18, 2020 in Santa Cruz, aged 40.
